intro: Chouardia lakusicii, commonly known as the Lakusicii dandelion, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in East Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodland areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow and resemble those of the common dandelion. Chouardia lakusicii is noted for its ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain herbivorous insects.
